items.title: ‘The money went into his account’: Is my father trying to swindle me out of my grandparents’ $800K home?
items.description: “I came across a letter from my father’s bank showing a wire transfer of $195,000 from the buyer.”

items.title: Nearly 50% of adults are now ordering kids’ meals. ‘It’s economical and it’s filling.’
items.description: It seems we’re all in the mood for miniburgers and chicken fingers.

items.title: What is mortgage fraud — and why does the Trump administration keep accusing officials of doing it?

items.title: These companies are the economy’s ‘first responders’ to Fed rate cuts
items.description: Community banks are “Fed-policy translators” — and their shares are highly sensitive to central-bank decisions.
